Load the first sheet of radiocarbon_database_regional.xlsx and climateMeasurements.xlsx into two pandas DataFrames.
Drop any rows or columns from both DataFrames that are entirely NaN to retain only valid data.
Create a calendar-year column in each DataFrame: for the archaeological samples, year = 1950 − date; for the climate data, year = 1950 − (Age_ky.1 rounded to kyrs × 1000).
For every archaeological sample row, find the nearest earlier and later climate-data rows (by ‘year’) to bracket the sample’s year.
Pull the ‘ODP 967 wet-dry index’ from those two bracketing climate rows and mark the sample as increasing (1) if the later value minus earlier value is positive, otherwise 0.
Store this indicator in a new column ‘isIncreasing’, then take its mean across all samples and round to two decimals to obtain the percentage of time the wet-dry index was increasing.
